common_errors.cause: Input file is not a valid object file or executable
common_errors.solution: Verify file type: file <binary>. strip works on ELF, Mach-O, PE files.
Verify path and filename. Use ls to check.

common_errors.cause: Cannot read input or write output
common_errors.solution: Check file permissions. May need sudo for system binaries.

common_errors.cause: File is not an executable format strip understands
common_errors.solution: File may be script, bytecode, or unsupported format. Check with: file <binary>
Check strip --help. Common: -s (all symbols), -g (debug only), -K (keep specific)

common_errors.cause: Cannot replace original file (permissions, in use, filesystem issue)
common_errors.solution: Use -o to output to different file. Check filesystem isn't read-only.

common_errors.cause: Warning when stripping COMDAT sections (usually safe to ignore)
common_errors.solution: This is typically a warning, not error. Binary is still stripped.

common_errors.cause: Internal error processing binary (may be corrupted or unsupported)
common_errors.solution: Try rebuilding binary. May be unsupported feature or corruption.

common_errors.cause: Binary already has no symbols to strip
common_errors.solution: Binary already stripped. No action needed.

common_errors.cause: macOS: Universal binary with multiple architectures
common_errors.solution: Use -arch to specify architecture, or strip all: strip -arch all
